question.body: What event is described by the probability statement P("not D" and "not B")?

response.feedback: Correct. "Not D" means the dining room alarm did not ring. "Not B" means the bedroom alarm did not ring. "Not D" and "not B" means these events occurred together, so neither alarm rang.
Incorrect. If at least one alarm rang, then we want to find P(A or B). This is the complement of the event "not D" and "not B."
Incorrect. There are two events that describe the situation where only one alarm rangs: (D and "not B") or ("not D" and B).
Incorrect. When both alarms ring, the event is (D and B).

part.hint: "Not D" and "not B" means these events occurred together.
